rpCofactors’s Documentation¶

Indices and tables¶

  • Index

Introduction¶

Welcome rpCofactors’s documentation. This tool adds cofactors to mono-component reaction rules from RetroRules and must be used after rpReader.

Note

This projects relies on rpUnicity project to filter any duplicates that may occur due to differen reaction rules having the same cofactors.

To build the docker you must build a rpBase and rpCache docker, and then you can use the following command:

docker build -t brsynth/rpcofactors-standalone:v2 .

You can run the docker using the following command to parse the rpReader:

python run.py -input test/test_rpReader.tar -output test/test_rpCofactors.tar -input_format tar

API¶

class rpTool.rpCofactors¶

Bases: object

Class to add the cofactors to a monocomponent reaction to construct the full reaction

addCofactors(rpsbml, compartment_id='MNXC3', pathway_id='rp_pathway', pubchem_search=False)¶

Function to reconstruct the heterologous pathway

Read each pathway information and RetroRules information to construct heterologous pathways and add the cofactors

Parameters

  • rpsbml (rpSBML) – The rpSBML object with a single model

  • compartment_id (str) – The id of the SBML compartment of interest

  • pathway_id (str) – The Groups id of the heterologous pathway

  • pubchem_search (bool) – Query the pubchem database

Return type

bool

Returns

Success or failure of the function

addCofactors_step(step, pathway_cmp)¶

Add the cofactors to monocomponent reactions

Parameters

  • step (dict) – Step in a pathway

  • pathway_cmp (dict) – Intermediate compounds with their public ID’s

Return type

bool

Returns

Success or failure of the function

completeReac(step, rr_reac, full_reac, mono_side, rr_string, pathway_cmp)¶

Given a dictionnary describing a monocomponent reaction, add the cofactors by comparing it with the original reaction

Parameters

  • step (dict) – Dictionnary describing the reaction

  • reac_side (str) – String ‘right’ or ‘left’ describing the direction of the monocomponent reaction compared with the original reaction

  • rr_reac (dict) – Dictionnary describing the monocomponent reaction from RetroRules

  • f_reac (dict) – Dictionnary describing the full original reaction

  • pathway_cmp (dict) – Dictionnary used to retreive the public ID of the intermediate compounds. Resets for each individual pathway

Return type

tuple

Returns

The tuple with the status of the function and the complete reaction string

class rpToolServe.main(inputTar, outputTar, pathway_id='rp_pathway', compartment_id='MNXC3', pubchem_search=False)¶

Load the cache to add the cofactors to an archive of rpSBML files

Parameters

  • inputTar (str) – Path to the tar archive containing rpSBML files

  • outputTar (str) – Path to the output tar archive

  • pathway_id (str) – The Groups heterologous pathway id

  • compartment_id (str) – The compartment SBML id

  • pubchem_search (bool) – Use the pubchem database to search for missing cross reference

Return type

None

Returns

None

class rpToolServe.main_extrules(inputTar, outputTar, rxn_recipes, rules_rall_tsv, compounds_tsv, pathway_id='rp_pathway', compartment_id='MNXC3', pubchem_search=False)¶

Load the cache to add the cofactors to an archive of rpSBML files and accept external reaction rules

Parameters

  • outputTar (str) – Path to the output tar archive

  • rxn_recipes (str) – Path to reaction recipes

  • rules_rall_tsv (str) – Path to the reaction rules

  • compounds_tsv (str) – Path to the compounds file

  • pathway_id (str) – The Groups heterologous pathway id

  • compartment_id (str) – The compartment SBML id

  • pubchem_search (bool) – Use the pubchem database to search for missing cross reference

Return type

None

Returns

None

class rpToolServe.runSingleSBML(rpcofactors, member_name, rpsbml_string, pathway_id='rp_pathway', compartment_id='MNXC3', pubchem_search=False)¶

Add the cofactors to a rpSBML file

Parameters

  • rpcofactors (rpCofactors) – The rpCofactors object

  • member_name (str) – The name of the file

  • rpsbml_string (str) – The string of the rpSBML file

  • pathway_id (str) – The Groups heterologous pathway id (Default: rp_pathway)

  • compartment_id (str) – The compartment SBML id (Default: MNXC3)

  • pubchem_search (bool) – Use the pubchem database to search for missing cross reference (Default: False)

Return type

str

Returns

The rpSBML string

class run.main(inputfile, input_format, output, rxn_recipes='None', rules_rall='None', compounds='None', pathway_id='rp_pathway', compartment_id='MNXC3', pubchem_search='False')¶

Function to call the rpCofactors docker

Parameters

  • inputfile (str) – Path to the input file

  • input_format (str) – The input file format. Valid options: tar, sbml

  • output (str) – Path to the output tar archive

  • rxn_recipes (str) – Path to reaction recipes (Default: None)

  • rules_rall_tsv (str) – Path to the reaction rules (Default: None)

  • compounds_tsv (str) – Path to the compounds file (Default: None)

  • pathway_id (str) – The Groups heterologous pathway id (Default: pathway_id)

  • compartment_id (str) – The compartment SBML id (Default: MNXC3)

  • pubchem_search (bool) – Use the pubchem database to search for missing cross reference (Default: False)

Return type

None

Returns

None
